<color=orange>Excavation Site</color>
1
COLEUS: I have been studying what causes the warp towers' rotating doors to open and close intermittently on their own, even in the absence of input from any Nomai.
2
1
COLEUS: After closer study, I can confidently conclude that the phenomenon is not caused by any structural defect in the doors. Instead, I suspect the cause to be the sunless tide.
3 2
COLEUS: As the Hourglass Twins orbit around each other, they become aligned along a straight line with the sun at regular intervals, with one twin closer towards the sun.
4
3
COLEUS: During this alignment, the twin farther from the sun feels not only the sun's great gravity - but also gravity from the twin closer to the sun, pulling it in the same direction.
5
4
COLEUS: These combined gravitational forces from the sun and another celestial body cause an extraordinarily strong pull of gravity towards the body closer to the sun.
6
5
COLEUS: This effect is most clearly visualized through sand being funneled towards the other twin - but the force also affects the vision orbs, pulling them upwards and causing them to activate every time Ember Twin orbits overhead!
7
6
YARROW: Goodness! My gratitude for all your hard work, Coleus. I shall pass this scroll to our friends at the <color=orange>Sun Station</color> to share your findings with them!

2
COLEUS: I was reminded of the phenomenon while studying this warp tower, since the alignment with a second body always causes a solar eclipse!
